data.title: Update the documentation of LaysTerrain

EDIT: This only updates the `Desc`s now.

On bleed the testcase looks like this:

While it's supposed to be like this:

data.title: Add ability to delay capture with an enginer
data.body: After the time capture delay is out you can self delay the capture till a harvester docks at the ref for example.

data.title: Ability to force fire AA and Sam Site
data.body: Add the ability to force fire in the air for air shooting units. Also make the turrets turn slower.

data.title: When changing rally point also make primary #12855
data.body:
Set PrimaryBuilding together with RallyPoint when Ctrl is pressed for each building which is the only selected building of that type. Ctrl is optional, could be removed to set PrimaryBuilding.

Barracks + Light factory, Ctrl+Right click = RallyPoint + PrimaryBuilding

![rallypointwithprimarybuilding](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/24041726/fbc08714-0b0e-11e7-910c-f92842d8723c.jpg)

2 Barracks = only RallyPoint

data.title: Connection Failed when trying to join custom map #12881
data.body: _ToDictionary(o => o.Id, o => o)_ failed due to duplicated Rule Id, e.g. PlayerResourcesInfo rules from Player and World, but it seems options from server.Map.Rules aren't needed here, as they are all added in LoadMapSettings function into defaults so I assume it is better to simply remove it than fix the duplicity again here.

data.body: Used  "Battlefield Control" instead of "Server" or ""

data.title: Global chat name is reset when connecting
data.body:
removed TrySetNickname(Game.Settings.Player.Name) in GlobalChat ctor overwriting Chat.Nickname. instead of removing, it could be replaced by TrySetNickname(Game.Settings.Chat.Nickname)

Closes #12325.

data.title: [RA] [Balance] Tweak price/production of S.Bags/Fence/Walls
data.body:
Fairly predictable change with positive feedback. The ca. 5s vs 2.5s wall spam made players more anxious weighing wall production against defensive structures specifically when in a base push/defense scenario. Compared to other nerf solutions, the double price/production time increase is also practical given the early game Engineer cap has become a total non-issue, effectively abolishing the need walls to encapsulate the starting MCV (comparatively cost of $800 vs $400).

The strength of the wall remains and is still a bargain with its chain build ability giving you up to 7x500 Concrete HP for just $200 add-ons. Building walls far and wide isn't disrupted but adding additional layers upon an enemy breakthrough is.

Casual players looking to play sim city ought to still to have a good experience using walls with this change.

$25 fence/s.bags just looks a bit bogus both as a price tag and with the visual production indicator. Spending cash on spamming $50 fence/s.bags is fine and looks better IMO.

- - - - - - - - - 

References:

RA Experimental build v2.0-v2.2: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19886
SoS Playtest maps v1.5r: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=19944 : http://resource.openra.net/panel/mymaps/page/2

data.title: UncloakOn: Damage, Heal, SelfHeal split
data.body:
This PR splits `UncloakOn: Damage` into `UncloakOn: Damage`, `UncloakOn: Heal`, `UncloakOn: SelfHeal`.
`Damage` if damage > 0.
`Heal` if damage < 0 and caused by another actor.
`SelfHeal` if damage < 0 and caused by self (ex. `SelfHealing`).

Fixes #12964 & fixes #12956.

data.title: [RA] Map Pool - Reverse alteration of Dual Cold Front
data.body:
Following the discussion of:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=300786#300786

This also follows a recent break of attitude of mine towards competitive, balanced maps in the official RA map pool. 2016 needed it IMO but as of now it looks to have settled in a decent spot. Regardless there's no justification of altering (a popular) Dual Cold Front, making it less distinctive in the official map pool to follow guidelines for the competitive meta.

data.title: Reverse making friendly units aware of friendly mines.
data.body:
Adressing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12337#issuecomment-285991709

I believe the new mines change represents a potential pitfall. My thoughts on it could be wrong but if they're not it could have very serious ramifications for the game balance the next release cycle. Not worth throwing in blind.

With #12337 players can add the property onto modded maps. Units being aware of friendly mines have been discussed up and down among players in the recent past so I'm positive we'll see it with community playtesters sooner or later.

data.title: Reorganize Windows game launcher to support per-mod launchers.
data.body:
This sets up our windows launcher and packaging to support per-mod launchers for both https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModTemplate and our official mods once we drop the mod chooser.  This is the Windows equivalent of #12824 / https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/pull/2.

https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commit/a16576a464b74d1bfcc3cd7e4fde24111d2f47bd shows how this will work for per-mod launchers in a future pr (which is currently blocked by #12909 and some other installer changes).  For now this continues to build a mod-independent OpenRA.exe launcher.

A test installer built using our normal packaging scripts can be found [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/i7zomvw2su2dbdf/OpenRA-test-20170314.exe?dl=0).
The appveyor test installer can be found [here](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/OpenRA/openra/build/1.0.14695/artifacts).

data.title: RA: Weird behavior with fix rally point
data.body:
I long suspected something is up with the rally point of the fix but couldn't quite put my finger on it.

But with one of the recent patches someone was kind enough to introduce TS like automatic gates in the RA mod.

Using those I found strange behavior, maybe it will help someone investigate what's up with the fix rally point.

Setup:

Have Service depot and production building and enclose it by a concrete wall with gates.
Set rally points outside the walls

Units produced from production buildings will go to their rally point, pathing through the gate as expected. 

Units that leave the service depot after repair however will follow the rally point straight towards the wall and then stop.

data.title: UncloakOn: Damaged is trigged by SelfHealing
data.body:
A unit with Cloak Trait with UncloakOn: Dock and a SelfHealing Trait will uncloak as soon as the selfheal triggers.

not quite sure if this is intended. I expected it to only apply to repairs/rearm from the designated building.

data.title: VeteranProductionIconOverlay doesn't update if Prerequisites are removed
data.body:
In my custom mod I noticed that the VeteranProductionIconOverlay isn't removed if the Prerequisite for ProducibleWithLevel is removed (I granted the Prerequisite via a building instead of infiltration).

So if the building is destroyed it will still show the production Icon with the overlay but the units will no longer be produced with veterancy.

data.title: TD Campaign AI Harvesters.
data.body: Whenever the AI runs out of the tiberium field or rebuilds a harvester they love to hug the bottom right of the map rather then finding more tiberium. (IE: Nod mission 07b)

data.title: TD Nod mission 06a airstrikes.
data.body: In the mission Nod06a when you attack the village as the secondary objective it triggers an airstrike from the AI and the three planes instantly kills the army. This renders completing the secondary objective impossible.

data.title: Grenadier death explosion fixed
data.body:
During his "empty ammo" state the Grenadier uses the incorrect weapon for his death explosion. I explained it more in-depth during the commit:

- When the Grenadier throws his grenade he enters a state of being "empty" for a while (until his ammo is replenished and he can throw again). If he is killed and explodes upon death during this "empty state" the Explodes trait will use "EmptyWeapon" instead of "Weapon".

- EmptyWeapon has however not been set to anything in infantry.yaml and therefore defaults to "UnitExplode" - an explosion that is over 12 times stronger than "UnitExplodeSmall" and covers a larger area.

- What this commit does is make sure the Grenadier's death explosion will always have the same strength. My reasoning is that it was probably never intended for the bang to be so strong in the first place, especially since it happens when the unit has no ammo loaded.

This is something I disovered when making the so-called ["overhaul"](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19940) and thought it would be perfect as a test commit since it's such a simple fix yet can have a big impact on gameplay. Using GitHub is relatively unfamiliar for me so I'm still learning the ropes.

data.title: Sort 'Playing' games in the lobby by play time.
data.body:
'Playing' games are now sorted top-bottom by the amount of players in a match as with 'Waiting' games. You can sort of get an idea of how many players are online by looking down the 'Playing' servers to the top.

Still I think I'd find it more interesting to see what games started moments ago vs games that has elapsed for longer by progressively looking down the list.

data.title: Technology Centers and Bio Labs
data.body:
I'm late to the party so this has probably been discussed multiple times but, I'll just post about it anyway.

**Technology Centers**
![technology_center](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23836106/544a7f3a-0749-11e7-8237-5d5927f39bdb.jpg)

Right now the Technology Center serves no purpose. 
If it was given a feature, it could present the team that captures it with a unit or structure that's exclusive to another faction or a specific country of either faction (regardless of the captors allegiance).

Could be a spy, grenadier, mammoth, phase tank, airfield, iron curtain, flamethrower, chronosphere (or tank), mechanic, medic, Tesla trooper, kennel, heavy tank, etc.

The only reason I bring this up is because in Yuri's Revenge there was the Tech Secret Lab which served that exact purpose.

![vhaps20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23835917/09ebe47c-0746-11e7-9eb1-d7c2a1efaae7.png)

------

**Biological Labs**
![sarin](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23836160/46f9b552-074a-11e7-906b-a15442049d51.png)

To follow the theme of the missions in the beginning of Red Alert as well as Aftermath/Retaliation, if captured, the Biological Labs could provide access to Sarin Nerve Gas either in the form of Chem Trucks or Chemical Bombing Runs.

![faluuko](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23835926/2f94f0a6-0746-11e7-8f78-2a2a6e8bce99.jpg)

Whereas the Demo Truck and the Airstrikes could damage anything within their vicinity, the Chem Trucks and/or Chemical Bombing Runs could harm and kill ONLY infantry within its area of influence.
It would then leave the green gas effect used for the nerve gas in the campaign (recolor of the flare sprite).

The truck could detonate like the Demo Truck and have a similar blast radius.

In terms of sprite work, I guess the Demo Truck's atomic decal could be recolored green instead of yellow.

------

![itcamefromredalert_poster](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23836062/48d2d84c-0748-11e7-807e-46d7ef00e590.jpg)

I've heard that the Bio Labs were going to produce zombies and ants which seem kind of out of place. I know "It CAmE FrOm ReeEeeed AleEeeErt oooOoOoo~ spoooOooky~ !" 
I still have the folder with the promo ant wallpaper and desktop theme on my laptop (cause I use the interface sounds for my desktop theme). 

But, I never was crazy about those ants or the dinosaurs. It just came off as out of place but, at the same time, Jurassic Park came out when Dawn did and "Mars Attacks!" came out the same year as Red Alert 1 so throwing in cheesy B Movie horror monsters was a fun little gag but, it was better off on its own; not as an ongoing feature.

If you guys are dead set on having an entrepreneur mad scientist lab that wants to capitalize on the market for BOTH giant insects AND Soviet (not Nazi) zombies then, maybe at the very least make two versions of the Biological Lab:

One for the Sarin and another just for the B-Movie stuff.

![g1zgdrk](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23835982/05b944e8-0747-11e7-9f6d-2a510442840b.jpg)

Or better yet, use some assets for some of the fan-made castle stuff to make a spoopy castle for the zombies and ants and keep the Bio Lab just for the chemical warfare. 

I think I was one of the only people playing the game back in the day that said, "They get tanks with two barrels, lightning tanks, AND poison gas?! Why can't I use poison gas?!" 

Opting to make the campy gag units available as part of the norm in a Red Alert/C&C game is just weird because it'll go against the whole "too much of a good thing" motif and the zombies and ants will quickly lose their novelty value (much like the zombie game genre today).

That's just my thought on the matter though.

![tech tech](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23835962/bd1ac8d8-0746-11e7-8d9f-53edd354d960.png)

I wouldn't say the Tech Lab placement would need to be fixed in existing maps. Most of the time, people place hazards near them in anticipation of them someday serving a purpose.
In fact, almost every map that features the Tech Lab has barbed wire and barrels around it or even entire concrete wall perimeters. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x6loeCpRBZ4

The Renegade X style of adding new tech would be cool. Maybe instead of adding Tiberian Sun tech it could add Tiberian Dawn tech to save on resources by reusing existing ones.

While the one additional unit would be completely random, it could add some interesting tech. 

- If a faction owns an airfield, they could get the Warthogs (the jets used in the airstrikes).
- If a faction owns a helipad, they could get either the Apache or the Orca.
- They could even get the Advanced Comm Center to grant access to Ions but, since it's being used against 1940s buildings, it would be a 1HK against whatever is directly under the crosshair (cursor).

I don't think the Temple would be necessary though. Maybe Dawn vehicles with slightly more damage than all standard vehicles would be okay.
Ex: GDI Medium Tank could do as much damage as a Heavy Tank and slightly higher damage resistance than the RA version. 

I won't go too in-depth since this is all essentially wishful thinking.

But, yeah, the possibilities would be endless.

data.title: Volkov (Soviet Tanya)
data.body:
I have proposed this idea on the forum but, decided to pitch the idea here as well with some additional notes I've compiled from both playing OpenRA and reception received on the forum.

As a disclaimer, I have never played Mental Omega and only know of the characters from playing the original games on CD. 

------

I noticed that with all the new vehicles and abilities added to Red Alert, there actually are some preexisting assets that somehow haven't made a return yet.

Sure everyone remembers Tanya, the RA Lara Croft-turned-007 via countless re-castings but, what about the Soviet "Tanya"? 

I'm not talking about Boris. I'm talking about Volkov and his canine companion, Chitzkoi.
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Volkov
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Chitzkoi

For those of you that don't remember, Volkov, was a Russian cyborg supersoldier armed with a sniper rifle for long range, high powered pistol for close range, and a heavy explosives cannon for air units and naval/ground vehicles.

He was an underrated character that was even supposed to return in Red Alert 2 but, was ultimately cut despite still appearing on the cover art.

![ra2-cover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23835470/43919bf2-073e-11e7-8d21-128a7de0fe99.jpg)

Like Volkov, Chitzkoi was cut from Red Alert 2 as well and only appeared in campaign missions.
He was cybernetically enhanced like Volkov with his own sets of perks to boot.

Despite resembling the average attack dog, he was capable of scaling cliffs and could take a few more beatings than a regular Attack Dog. Despite being a cyborg dog, he could still be crushed by vehicles, however, he had a movement speed of 8 as opposed to the Attack Dog movement speed of 4 (the increased speed can be achieved in the current build of OpenRA by having dogs walk on roads).
Interestingly, all Attacks Dogs in the game inherited Chitzkoi's cliff climbing ability.

To keep up with the new additions that came with OpenRA, both units could be able to detect cloaked units.

---------

- Below are additional notes I compiled after receiving feedback on the forum -

I have heard some concerns about Volkov being "overpowered" but, in the original Red Alert, both factions had access to Tanya but, this did not carry over into OpenRA.

Right now, the Soviets don't have a Hero unit and the sprite work for Volkov is in the original game's files (or the expansions) so it wouldn't require a complete recreation from the ground up.

If we were to really take a moment to look at Volkov, he's just a Mammoth Tank in infantry form which isn't all that OP if you think about it. 

Since the Sniper already exists in-game and may be going to England, why not repurpose Volkov into being a Soviet anti-vehicle and infantry sniper?

Instead of giving him a high-powered pistol (like RoboCop), give him a PTRD (the Russian anti-armor rifle from WW2). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PTRD

He could use the PTRD to inflict rocket launcher-like damage to vehicles from a safe distance and 1HK towards infantry (maybe 4 shots against Tanya for balancing). 
To add to the gory nature of classic Red Alert, firing the rifle at infantry could make them explode (as if they were killed with a grenade). Essentially, he would become the equivalent to Havoc in C&C: Renegade (or RenX) multiplayer. He could have the movement speed of a grenadier or rifleman.

Being a cyborg, he would keep his explosive canon for warding off aircraft. Also, he can't be crushed by vehicles (because cyborg and that would be a waste of about $1000 and he was also uncrushable in Aftermath). 

Like Tanya, only one of each (Volkov and Chitzkoi) can be present at any given time (unless given via crate) and like the Mammoth, he could regenerate 50% of his health (introduced in Counterstrike except regenerated 100%). 

For the sake of balancing, Volkov's PTRD could have the same fire rate as a medium tank (giving the illusion of reloading since it's a bolt-action). He also wouldn't be able to C4 buildings; making that a trait exclusive to Tanya (outside of campaign missions). His effective range could be one tile further than artillery or V2 to avoid having a game of "who will die first". 

Another suggestion to add some flare to his character, his death animation could be the electrocution death animation by-default (because cyborg).

If you guys don't want to add Chitzkoi, that's up to you. I heard he could attack vehicles in Mental Omega but, that sounds a bit too overpowered. Since he's just a dog, his price could be a fair $800 instead of $200.

I think that covers everything until I come up with something else to add later.
Do as you please with my proposal. I mean there's ants, zombies, and tech that was never in the original games so Volkov would be a considerably tame addition to the Soviet arsenal.

data.title: Unexpected UncloakOn Damage behavior
data.body:
The `UncloakOn: Damage` trait in D2K gets triggered even if the unit won't take damage.

Example:
If I let the rocket turret (same with the gun turret) shoot two cells away from the cloaked unit, it will be  uncloaked even it didn't lose any health.

| Stealth Unit Owner View | Turret Owner View |
|:-----:|:-----:|
|![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/23832207/89da308c-0730-11e7-9a38-0ad29f5f60ff.png) | ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/23832208/8c9b9c7a-0730-11e7-91f0-8673dd09abc7.png) |

It seems that the units get marked as damaged, despite being out of the area of damage.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/23832543/83485e28-0736-11e7-8191-63a78294e63a.png)|

data.title: Remove IDisable - part 1

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: First part of a series of PRs to remove `IDisable`. This removes `DisabledOverlay` using `WithColoredOverlay` and `GrantConditionOnDisabled` as a shim as well as converting `ProximityExternalCondition`, `RepairsUnits`, and `Production`. This PR also halts repairs and production when they are disabled. I noticed that the EMP effect does not stop repairs or production in the `ts` mod as is.

data.title: Option for textsupport as alternative for soundeffects
data.body:
When i installed the original Dune2, ive noticed that when i dont select a soundcard for music/effects, the game will switch to a subtitle-mode alarming me for all sorts of events that are happening ingame, such as "Harvester deployed", "Construction complete" or "Base is under attack" ... 

Back then in the 90s it wasnt quite uncommon to have a machine with no soundcard so i guess that was the reason for this feature.

However, i think we could use this (as "Silent Mode" -option in the settings) to support people with a hearing disorder so they can play OpenRA without difficulties

![baseunder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/23828877/60280bce-06e0-11e7-8995-d1e1eed1a290.png)

data.title: D2K - Make defences detect Cloak
data.body: In original Infantry and Turrets were able to detect cloaked units in 1 cell range including diagonal. Looks like Turrets were missing that on OpenRA. I didn't add Detection Circle as it would be unnecessary for that small range.

data.title: NukeUp animation cycles through the map given a large enough FlightDelay
data.body:
The nuke missile launched from MSLO, if given a large enough FlightDelay, will reemerge from the bottom of the map and continue to the top. This process repeats and continues until impact.

Values tested: 
 - 1500 (no cycling)
 - 15000 (cycling observed)
 - 45000 (cycling observed)

To reproduce:

Set the following rules
MSLO:
	NukePower:
		FlightDelay: 45000
Launch a nuke.

or

Open and play
http://resource.openra.net/maps/19901/
The flight delay has already been set to 45000 in this map

Perform any of the following actions to make the AI fire its missile:
 - Attack any Nuke Silo or the forward command post (rush build two Hinds to make this quicker).
 - Approach the Nuke Silos with ground troops.
 - Destroy 15 Soviet structures.
 - Destroy the Soviet Construction Yard.

Observe the vertical axis where the nuke silos are.
The missile can be seen through the fog of war, but not through the shroud.

An oversight with #12739.
